content.question: Two positively charged metal spheres with different radii are initially separated by a great distance. Initially Sphere <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has charge <math alttext="10 nanocoulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>10</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>nC</mtext></mstyle></math> and the electric potential at the surface of Sphere <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is <math alttext="900 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>900</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mstyle></math>. Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has charge <math alttext="8 nanocoulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>8</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>nC</mtext></mstyle></math> and the electric potential at the surface of Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is <math alttext="1,800 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>1800</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mstyle></math>. The two spheres are brought into contact with one another and are then returned to their original separation. Which of the following describes the electric potential at the surface of Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and the charge of Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, after it touches Sphere <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and is returned to its initial position?

choices.label: The electric potential at the surface and the charge of Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> both increase.
The electric potential at the surface and the charge of Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> both decrease.
The electric potential at the surface decreases and the charge of Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> increases.
The electric potential at the surface increases and the charge of Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> decreases.

content.answer: The electric potential at the surface and the charge of Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> both decrease.
